column2: Yikes: E-mails show DeSantis team asked CBS 60 Minutes to interview Moskowitz -- and were told "the deadline has passed"
column5: DidÂ 60 Minutes go out of its way to concoct the hit piece on Ron DeSantis? New e-mails published by Fox News this morning show that the Florida governorâ€™s team tried to arrange an interview between Sharyn Alfonsi and the Democrat in charge of the stateâ€™s emergency response agency along with the Democratic mayor of Palm Beach County to explain the Publix partnership. They even offered to make Jared Moskowitz available by Skype or in person. â€œUnfortunately the deadline has passedâ€ theÂ 60 MinutesÂ producer responded: According to the emails obtained by Fox News Beatrice then requested Zill de Granados and Gordon interview Moskowitz who she said was available that day and Friday to do an interview either in a studio or by Skype. The â€œ60 Minutesâ€ producer replied that they had requested an on-the-record interview with Moskowitz â€œrepeatedlyâ€ since February and claimed that he had not responded to messages since mid-March. Did you see that perspective?â€ Moskowitz added. I did speak with @60Minutes. Never said I didnâ€™t. They were very nice but I told them that the @publix story was â€œbullshitâ€. Walked them through the whole process.The fact that I didnâ€™t sit down on â€œcameraâ€ because I am responding to a 100 year emergency doesnâ€™t change the truth https://t.co/G7QNsV42V5 â€” Jared MASKowitz ğŸ˜· (@JaredEMoskowitz) April 6 2021  TheÂ 60 MinutesÂ team keeps making reference to â€œdeadlinesâ€ but thatâ€™s nonsense. A deadline isnâ€™t more important than getting the storyÂ right. Thatâ€™s true for a newspaper on a daily schedule and itâ€™s even more true for aÂ weekly television news program. Even beyond that one has to wonder whether anyone at 60 Minutes  or CBS News even watched their own segment.
